conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container each liquid will flow into.
Baffles are designed to redirect the flow of the liquid, and the containers at the bottom will collect the liquid.
The baffles are labeled A, B, C, and D.
The containers are labeled E, F, and G.
Liquid from Baffle A will flow through the baffle and be directed towards the left container.
Liquid from Baffle B will flow through the baffle and be directed towards the middle container.
Liquid from Baffle C will flow through the baffle and be directed towards the middle container.
Liquid from Baffle D will flow through the baffle and be directed towards the right container.
Liquid from Baffle A will flow into container E.
Liquid from Baffle B will flow into container F.
Liquid from Baffle C will flow into container F.
Liquid from Baffle D will flow into container G.
Final answer: Liquid from A will flow into container E, Liquid from B will flow into container F, Liquid from C will flow into container F, Liquid from D will flow into container G.
